channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MI

item.title: Report X-2024020090
item.description:
Report X-2024020090

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-02
  • City: LIVONIA
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE DUE TO THE RATTLE OF AEROSOLS CANS. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED (2) 11 OUNCES AEROSOL CANS OF FLAMMABLE ELMER'S MULTI-PURPOSE SPRAY ADHESIVE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER E53034, EPIC - DEEP SPACE, 1979 MILKY WAY, VERONA WI 53593-9179.

item.title: Report X-2024020330
item.description:
Report X-2024020330

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-16
  • City: OAK PARK
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Driver found leaking pack in van while making his deliveries. Package was found by QA when doing VSA. DescribePack: 1 out of 4 jugs of Morado super cleaner had a loose cap and leaked. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a bin and sent to the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2024020388
item.description:
Report X-2024020388

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-19
  • City: STERLING HEIGHTS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The trailer was being unloaded on the inbound sort during which the 5 gallon drum was placed on a flat tray for stability and sent down the line toward the designated work area. Upon the arrival to the work area it was noticed that the lid on the drum was dented and a very minor amount of the product was leaking and on the side of the drum. QA was contacted where the drum was placed in a tote lined with spill pads and removed from the area DescribePack: The lid is dented at the edge about 1.5 inches in length DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: QA was contacted where the drum was placed in a tote lined with spill pads and removed from the area

item.title: Report X-2024020283
item.description:
Report X-2024020283

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T00:33:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-12
  • City: GRAND RAPIDS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WET HAZMAT BOX WAS FOUND DURING THE LOADING PROCESS AND BROUGHT OVER FOR INSPECTION. UPON INSPECTION IT WAS FOUND TO BE A DAMAGED HAZMAT AND THE HAZMAT PROCESS WAS STARTED. DescribePack: UPON INSPECTION THE BUCKET WAS FOUND TO BE DENTED IN SEVERAL SPOTS BUT THE DENT IN THE LID WAS WHAT WAS CAUSING THE LEAK. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: BOX WAS TURNED RIGHT SIDE UP ACCORDING TO THE DIRECTIONAL ARROWS PRINTED ON THE BOX.

item.title: Report X-2024020498
item.description:
Report X-2024020498

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-24
  • City: GRAND RAPIDS

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A WET HAZMAT BOX WAS FOUND DURING THE UNLOADING PROCESS AND BROUGHT OVER FOR INSPCTION. UPON INSPCTIONS IT WAS FOUND TO BE A DAMAGED HAZMAT AND THE HAZMAT PROCESS WAS STARTED. DescribePack: CAP TO ONE OF THE GALLON JUGS WAS FOUND TO BE LOOSE AND THE CAUSE OF THE LEAK. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: BOX WAS TURNED RIGHT SIDE UP ACCORDING TO THE DIRECTIONAL ARROWS ON THE BOX.
